academia
Applied Academics manages collaborative
relationships with a constantly growing
think tank of academic researchers selected
on the basis of their work's relevance to
practice and keen interest in deploying their
ideas in the finance industry. Our core
business is to identify ideas with the great
est potential and maximize their value in
partnership with professors and industry
clients.
Partners / Clients
Applied Academics manages collaborative relationships with a
constantly growing think tank of academic researchers selected
on the basis of their work's relevance to practice and keen interest
in deploying their ideas in the finance industry. Our core business
is to identify ideas with the greatest potential and maximize their
value in partnership with professors and industry clients.

Applied Academics manages collaborative relationships with a
constantly growing think tank of academic researchers selected
on the basis of their work's relevance to practice and keen interest
in deploying their ideas in the finance industry. Our core business
is to identify ideas with the greatest potential and maximize their
value in partnership with professors and industry clients.
Partners / Clients
Partners 1
Client 1
Client 2

Partners 2
Partners 3
Yoshiki founded Applied Academics LLC in 2009. He previously managed
investment grade and high yield US and Asian credit portfolios for a proprietary
fixed-income trading group of an investment bank in Tokyo. Yoshiki has also been
a consultant to major global inter-dealer brokerage firms for the implementation
of quantitative equity and credit derivatives models. He holds a PhD in Finance
and Economics from Columbia Business School where he conducted empirical
research on US and European credit and interest rate markets.
Jean-Denis Greze
Jean-Denis has been at Applied Academics LLC since 2010. He previously
worked as a consultant and software engineer focusing on systems programming.
He also worked as an attorney for Sullivan & Cromwell LLP in their New York and
Paris offices. He holds a JD from Harvard Law School and a BS and an MS in
Computer Science from Columbia University.
Yoshiki founded Applied Academics LLC in 2009. He previously managed
investment grade and high yield US and Asian credit portfolios for a propri
etary fixed-income trading group of an investment bank in Tokyo. Yoshiki has
also been a consultant to major global inter-dealer brokerage firms for the
implementation of quantitative equity and credit derivatives models. He holds
a PhD in Finance and Economics from Columbia Business School where he
conducted empirical research on US and European credit and interest rate
markets.
Jean-Denis Greze
Jean-Denis has been at Applied Academics LLC since 2010. He previously
worked as a consultant and software engineer focusing on systems program
ming. He also worked as an attorney for Sullivan & Cromwell LLP in their New
York and Paris offices. He holds a JD from Harvard Law School and a BS and
an MS in Computer Science from Columbia University.

pirical research on US and European credit and interest rate mar

Applied Academics manages collaborative relationships with a
constantly growing think tank of academic researchers selected
on the basis of their work's relevance to practice and keen interest
in deploying their ideas in the finance industry. Our core business
is to identify ideas with the greatest potential and maximize their
value in partnership with professors and industry clients.
